Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap

Class IMAPServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Connector
      • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.Server
        • org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.IMAPServer
  • public class IMAPServer
extends Server
    Connection factory for IMAP connections on a given port. This connector supports both standard IMAP (port 143) and IMAPS (port 993), with transparent SSL/TLS support and STARTTLS capability.

    This implementation supports IMAP4rev2 as defined in RFC 9051, with the following extensions:

    • RFC 2177 - IDLE (push notifications)
    • RFC 2342 - NAMESPACE
    • RFC 6851 - MOVE
    • RFC 9208 - QUOTA
    Author:
    Chris Burdess
    See Also:
    RFC 9051 - IMAP4rev2, RFC 2177 - IDLE, RFC 2342 - NAMESPACE, RFC 6851 - MOVE, RFC 9208 - QUOTA

        the mailbox factory, or null if not configured

      • setMailboxFactory

        public void setMailboxFactory​(MailboxFactory mailboxFactory)
        Sets the mailbox factory for creating mailbox store instances. Each IMAP connection will use this factory to obtain a mail store for the authenticated user.
        Parameters:
        mailboxFactory - the factory to create mailbox instances

      • getQuotaManager

        public QuotaManager getQuotaManager()
        Returns the quota manager for this server.
        Returns:
        the quota manager, or null if quotas are not enabled

      • setQuotaManager

        public void setQuotaManager​(QuotaManager quotaManager)
        Sets the quota manager for enforcing storage quotas. When configured, the IMAP server will:
        • Check quotas before APPEND commands
        • Respond to GETQUOTA and GETQUOTAROOT commands
        • Allow administrators to use SETQUOTA
        • Track storage usage after message operations
        Parameters:
        quotaManager - the quota manager

      • getHandlerFactory

        public ClientConnectedFactory getHandlerFactory()
        Returns the handler factory for this server.
        Returns:
        the handler factory, or null if not configured

      • setHandlerFactory

        public void setHandlerFactory​(ClientConnectedFactory handlerFactory)
        Sets the handler factory for creating IMAP handlers.

        When configured, the server delegates authentication and mailbox operations to handlers created by this factory. This allows custom policy decisions for authentication, mailbox access control, and message operations.

        If no handler factory is configured, the server uses its built-in implementation with the configured Realm and MailboxFactory.

        Parameters:
        handlerFactory - the factory to create handler instances

      • getLoginTimeoutMs

        Returns:
        the login timeout in milliseconds

      • setLoginTimeoutMs

        public void setLoginTimeoutMs​(long loginTimeoutMs)
        Sets the login timeout in milliseconds. This is the maximum time allowed for authentication.
        Parameters:
        loginTimeoutMs - the timeout in milliseconds

      • setLoginTimeout

        public void setLoginTimeout​(java.lang.String timeout)
        Sets the login timeout using a string with optional time unit suffix. Supported suffixes: ms, s, m, h (milliseconds, seconds, minutes, hours).
        Parameters:
        timeout - the timeout string (e.g., "60s", "1m")

      • setAllowPlaintextLogin

        public void setAllowPlaintextLogin​(boolean allowPlaintextLogin)
        Sets whether plaintext LOGIN is allowed over non-TLS connections.

        WARNING: This should only be enabled for testing. Enabling this in production exposes passwords to network eavesdropping.

        Parameters:
        allowPlaintextLogin - true to allow plaintext login

      • newConnection

        protected Connection newConnection​(java.nio.channels.SocketChannel channel,
                                   javax.net.ssl.SSLEngine engine)
        Creates a new IMAP connection for the given socket channel. For STARTTLS support: if secure=false but engine!=null, the connection starts as plaintext but can be upgraded.
        Specified by:
        newConnection in class Connector
        Parameters:
        channel - the socket channel for the client connection
        engine - the SSL engine (null if no SSL context, non-null if STARTTLS-capable)
        Returns:
        a new IMAPConnection instance

      • isSTARTTLSAvailable

        protected boolean isSTARTTLSAvailable()
        Checks if SSL/TLS context is available for STARTTLS.
        Returns:
        true if STARTTLS is supported, false otherwise

      • getCapabilities

        protected java.lang.String getCapabilities​(boolean authenticated,
                                           boolean secure)
        Returns the list of capabilities to advertise. This is used by IMAPConnection to build CAPABILITY responses.
        Parameters:
        authenticated - true if the user is authenticated
        secure - true if the connection is using TLS
        Returns:
        space-separated capability string
